newsitem.title: USA: Dow off more than 50 points, curbs set at 1516 EDT.
newsitem.headline: Dow off more than 50 points, curbs set at 1516 EDT.

text.p: The Dow industrials shed more than 50 points or 0.85 percent to 6038, prompting the NYSE to set curbs on index-arbitrage orders at 1516 EDT/1916 GMT.
Likewise, bond market losses mounted with the long bond off 1/2 point to yield 6.85 percent.

Analysts said that, for now, they only see a short-term shallow pullback for stocks that might last until the November U.S. elections. They noted weakness in the technology sector, despite some good profit news, indicated the market had lost its momentum.
The tech-studded Nasdaq Composite lost 20 to 1216.
